title: $8M South End penthouse in converted church has views of Prudential Center
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The $8M two-story penthouse, located in a converted 1868 church in Boston's South End, features a living area in an octagonal cupola.
The 3,508-square-foot unit includes three bedrooms, three and a half baths, and direct elevator access to two garage spaces.
Smart home features include electric window shades and stereo speakers, with the primary bedroom offering views of the Prudential Center.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 11)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington reported home sales with prices ranging from $415,000 for a condo to $735,000 for a raised ranch.
Arlington had a high-value property, a one-family Colonial on Valentine Road, sold for $2,100,000.
Boston's real estate highlights include a one-family row-middle house at 25 Upton St. sold for $4,035,000.

title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Hundreds of UMass Boston students were displaced after a burst sprinkler pipe caused flooding in East Residence Hall.
The Boston Fire Department and State Building Inspector extended 'no occupancy' status due to unsafe electrical systems.
UMass Boston reopened the East Residence dining hall and offered temporary housing at UMass Amherst, with shuttle service.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library recommends over 35 Seattle-themed books to Boston Public Library after Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss.
Titles include Michael Bennett's memoir and a humorous take on inflation; some allude to football rivalry.
Both libraries collaborate on 'Books Unbanned,' promoting uncensored reading rights for teens nationwide.

title: State auditor sues Beacon Hill to force compliance with audit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio filed a lawsuit to enforce her authority to audit the Massachusetts Legislature as approved by voters.
Attorney General Andrea Campbell and the Legislature leadership oppose DiZoglio's lawsuit, disputing her audit authority and intent.
Republican figures support the audit initiative, citing transparency and advocating for legislative compliance with voter-approved measures.

title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, was arrested on human trafficking charges after a sting operation in the Seaport area.
The Sting was conducted by the Boston Police Human Trafficking Unit and State Police near Seaport Boulevard and Thompson Place.
Macean faces charges for human trafficking, commercial sex acts, and deriving support from prostitution; arraignment set in South Boston District Court.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Increased coyote sightings in Boston are due to their mating season from January to March.
MassWildlife advises keeping pets indoors and using 'hazing' tactics to deter coyotes.
Coyote attacks on humans are very rare in Massachusetts, with fewer than 10 reported in 60 years.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton praised Drake Maye's progress after the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss, despite prior criticism during the 2025 season.
Drake Maye acknowledged postseason struggles with turnovers and aims to use the experience for growth next season.
Maye, a regular season MVP runner-up, looks to rebound in 2026, following the loss to the Seattle Seahawks.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens named 2026 Beanpot MVP, helping Boston College win over Boston University 6-2 with two assists.
Bruins prospects Andre Gasseau and Dean Letourneau also excelled, contributing multiple goals in the Beanpot final.
Hagens, drafted seventh overall by Bruins in 2025, leads Boston College with 31 points in 24 games this season.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots CB Carlton Davis emphasizes attracting free agents for a strong offseason after a Super Bowl loss.
New England Patriots, led by QB Drake Maye and Coach Mike Vrabel, have $42.7 million in cap space.
Patriots aim to retain key players like Christian Gonzalez while attracting new talent in free agency.
